Posts.Content: Feb 22, 2014 05:40PM gabriellaM wrote: Hi Bessie and Juneping.  I only recently joined this group but since you are discussing articles related to surgery I was wondering if either of you had come across this study: http://bja.oxfordjournals.org/content/109/suppl_1...  I hope that link works but if not the title is "Can anesthetic and analgesic techniques affect cancer recurrence or metastasis?" (in British Journal of Anaesthesia).  It discusses the possibility that various types of anesthesia may promote metastasis/recurrence while other types may be protective.  Basically it seems to favor propofol and IV anesthesia over inhalant/volatile agents and also discusses the possibility that opioids suppress immune function and thus increase risk of metastasis.  I was wondering if you had heard anything about this type of research. Thanks!

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2014 07:18AM gabriellaM wrote: Hi, I just found out my mom has what is probably stage 3 IDC. We are meeting with a surgeon today and what I know so far is that she has a 6-10 cm tumor, described as poorly differentiated, and the one lymph node that they checked during her biopsy was positive. I don't know ER/PR status yet. My mom is 80 years old and has mild-moderate Alzheimers so limited understanding of what is going on. Does anyone know how one usually proceeds in this kind of situation? I assume the surgeon/oncologist will give us more info but just wondering if anyone has been or known someone in this situation. Thanks. BTW I had DCIS and had BMX in March (BRCA+) and I'm feeling fine. My mom's situation seems so different to mine as to almost be a different disease. I did not need chemo or radiation.

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2014 10:03PM gabriellaM wrote: I had an abnormal mammo in mid-Dec, couldn't schedule a bx til mid/end of Jan, and didn't have my bmx til March 21!  It seemed like an eternity but the holidays in Dec made scheduling the bx difficult and then the bx found DCIS so no one seemed in too much of a hurry.  It gave me a chance to get BRCA tested and turned out I am positive so that changed my surgery plans from unilateral to bilateral.  I know it's different for IDC but none of my doctors (I met with two different BS before I found someone I liked) seemed concerned with the delay.  I do agree with the person who said the squeaky wheel gets the grease though -- it's worth advocating for yourself but I think the main issue with waiting is psychological.  Everyone told me waiting was the worst part and it was true!  Good luck to you!
